Reasoning: **Shop Phase Analysis: Maximizing Score & Scaling**

Okay, here's the situation. I'm in the shop after picking "The High Priestess" from a Jumbo Arcana Pack. My immediate goal is to maximize score potential and scaling. I've got a decent Joker setup: Smiley Face (Face card mult), Mystic Summit (discard bonus), Spare Trousers (Two Pair mult), Luchador (Polychrome mult), Constellation (Planet card scaling), and Certificate (deck manipulation). I also have two consumables: Earth (Full House level up) and Venus (Three of a Kind level up). And I have $32.

The key right now is Constellation. It’s sitting at X1.6, gaining +0.1 Mult for every Planet card I use. Earth and Venus are key here. I need to make space in my consumable slots for potential future ones.

I've got a few options in the shop: Splash (Foil), Lusty Joker, a Standard Pack, Wasteful, and Reroll. Splash looks interesting, but I'd need to sell a Joker. # Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.

**Strategic Shop Navigation**

Mystic Summit (+15 Mult at 0 discards), Smiley Face (+5 Mult for faces), and Spare Trousers (+2 Mult for Two Pair) provide flat and scaling Mult. Luchador gives X1.5 and disables bosses, and Certificate adds a card. I've got a decent lineup, but I'm always looking to optimize.

The shop itself offers some interesting options, but nothing is immediately game-changing. I could buy Wily or Sly Joker, but I'd need to sell one of my current Jokers. Selling Smiley Face or Spare Trousers (+2) for a Wily Joker (+100 Chips) is tempting for immediate points, but I'm prioritizing Planets for Constellation. I can also buy a standard pack, but the value is pretty low in general. The Wasteful Voucher is immediately out â€“ extra discards hurt Mystic Summit. Rerolling is available, but that costs $6, dropping my interest below the max.

The math points to a simple strategy. Rerolling ($6) would leave me at $21, losing $1 of interest. I want to keep at least $25 for the max $5 interest. I have to decide if it's worth it. Given the lack of Planets in the shop, I think I'm better off moving to the next round, building up my money, and seeing what the next shop brings. I can always check `round_select` to verify.

Wait. Let me double-check something. I have to determine if Spare Trousers scales with Full Houses. The rules say that a full house *contains* a Two Pair. *This is huge*! If I play Full Houses (my best hand), Spare Trousers scales! This is great.

Okay, let's look at the available actions. I don't know the next blind, so I have to click `round_select`.

Given that I have $27, I could buy the Standard Pack ($4), but then I would have $23 and lose on interest. Certificate already adds cards.

I think it's time to move to `round_select`.
